Interested in serving on the ACLU-DC Board?
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Important Dates FOR BOARD ELECTIONS:

June 15: Petitions for Board nominees due
June 29: Voting instructions mailed to members
July 28: Due date to vote online for ACLU-DC Board

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

We are pleased to give notice of the opportunity to run for the Board of the ACLU of the District of Columbia (ACLU-DC) and to nominate others. Eight seats will be up for the D.C. affiliate Board. Board members serve three-year terms and are responsible for governance and fiscal stability, as well as attendance at six meetings each year. A member may be nominated by the Nominations Committee (see list below) or by submitting a petition signed by at least 10 ACLU-DC members and accompanied by a statement signed by the nominee expressing their willingness to serve if elected.

All those nominated must submit a statement (300 words or less) and a headshot (high-resolution digital file or print photo). Candidates may use their own petition form. The deadline for receipt of petitions (including statement and photo) at the ACLU-DC office is Saturday, June 15. Send petitions to: ACLU-DC Elections, 915 15th St NW, 2nd Floor, Washington, DC 20005. You may also email them to nominations@acludc.org.

Board elections will be conducted online. Voting information will be provided via email and a subsequent postcard. Any questions, please call 202-457-0800.

The people nominated to the ACLU-DC Board by the Nominations Committee for the 2019 election are: Paul Angelo, Laura Arandes, Anthony Balkissoon, Deborah Carliner, Uzoma Nkwonta, Mary Beth Tinker, Courtney Stewart, James Weingarten.

ACLU of the District of Columbia
